channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How politicians in the U.S. are reacting to the Iran strikes.
item.description: The Trump administration is doing a victory lap after a surprise attack on three Iranian nuclear sites Saturday. The White House is also facing pushback from some lawmakers.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is doing a victory lap after a surprise attack on three Iranian nuclear sites Saturday. The White House is also facing pushback from some lawmakers.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Satellites show damage to Iran's nuclear program, but experts say it's not destroyed
item.description: Satellite imagery shows trucks at two key sites the day before the American strikes, suggesting uranium could have been moved.
item.content:encoded: Satellite imagery shows trucks at two key sites the day before the American strikes, suggesting uranium could have been moved.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Trump administration defends Iranian strikes as some lawmakers question its legality
item.description: After the U.S. took military action against three nuclear sites in Iran, reaction across the political spectrum was swift with many Democrats decrying the president's "unilateral" strikes.
item.content:encoded:
After the U.S. took military action against three nuclear sites in Iran, reaction across the political spectrum was swift with many Democrats decrying the president's "unilateral" strikes.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: As Israel recovers the bodies of three more hostages, how many are still in Gaza?
item.description: Israel said Sunday that it has recovered the bodies of three more hostages taken in Hamas' Oct. 7 attack that ignited the ongoing 20-month war in the Gaza Strip.
item.content:encoded:
Israel said Sunday that it has recovered the bodies of three more hostages taken in Hamas' Oct. 7 attack that ignited the ongoing 20-month war in the Gaza Strip.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear sites show no sign of widespread environmental impact
item.description: So far, any chemical and radioactive contamination seems confined to the nuclear sites hit by U.S. bombs
item.content:encoded: So far, any chemical and radioactive contamination seems confined to the nuclear sites hit by U.S. bombs
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Iran's top officials condemn U.S. strikes and assert their right to self-defense
item.description: Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi called the American operation an "outrageous, grave and unprecedented violation" of the United Nations Charter and international law.
item.content:encoded:
Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi called the American operation an "outrageous, grave and unprecedented violation" of the United Nations Charter and international law.

(Image credit: Ozan Kose)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: World reacts to U.S. strikes on Iran with alarm, caution — and some praise
item.description: As the world reacted to news of U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, international officials largely responded with alarm and calls for restraint.
item.content:encoded:
As the world reacted to news of U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, international officials largely responded with alarm and calls for restraint.

(Image credit: Planet Labs PBC)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: FedEx founder Fred Smith, who revolutionized package delivery, dies at 80
item.description: Smith once said he came up with the name Federal Express because he wanted the company to sound big and important when in fact it was a start-up operation with a future far from assured.
item.content:encoded:
Smith once said he came up with the name Federal Express because he wanted the company to sound big and important when in fact it was a start-up operation with a future far from assured.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In this rural Colorado valley, cuts to Medicaid would have vast ripple effects
item.description: Cuts to Medicaid moving through Congress would shake up health care in the scenic San Luis Valley — with negative downstream effects on local jobs, businesses and education.
item.content:encoded:
Cuts to Medicaid moving through Congress would shake up health care in the scenic San Luis Valley — with negative downstream effects on local jobs, businesses and education.

(Image credit: Hart Van Denburg)
item.dc:creator: John Daley

item.title: What separates the ultrarich from the just-plain-rich? The gigayacht.
item.description: A new collection of essays by New Yorker writer Evan Osnos, The Haves and Have-Yachts, provides rich research and material for the conversation about extreme wealth in America today.
item.content:encoded: A new collection of essays by New Yorker writer Evan Osnos, The Haves and Have-Yachts, provides rich research and material for the conversation about extreme wealth in America today.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt
